sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A ballad intituled, A newe well a daye/ as playne maister papist, as Donstable waye. Well a daye well a daye, well a daye woe is mee Syr Thomas Plomtrie is hanged on a tree. Elderton, William, d. 1592?
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (coats of arms).
in Fleestrete [sic] beneath the conduit, at the signe of S. John Euangelist, by Thomas Colwell, Imprinted at London : [1570]
Signed: W.E. [i.e. William Elderton]. Date of publication from STC. Verse: "Amonge manye newes reported of late ..." Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
A ballad intituled, A newe well a daye/ as playne maister papist, as Donstable waye. Well a daye well a daye, well a daye woe is mee Syr Thomas Plomtrie is hanged on a tree. Elderton, William, d. 1592?
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (coats of arms).
in Fleestrete [sic] beneath the conduit, at the signe of S. John Euangelist, by Thomas Colwell, Imprinted at London : [1570]
Signed: W.E. [i.e. William Elderton]. Date of publication from STC. Verse: "Amonge manye newes reported of late ..." Reproduction of original in the British Library.
